page.title: 17Mr LLOYD
page.content: Geogina talked to Mr Lloyd of Pentre farm - one of the few people who were born in the village and have spent most of their lives in Painscastle. Mr Lloyd has lived in Painscastle for 74 years. He is Welsh ,owns a 147 acre farm and is a worthy patron of the village. He is well liked and respected by both young and old. He attended Painscastle school, leaving at the age of 14. He spends time talking to the village children and oviously enjoys the developement of his family's life in the village. His two grandchildren live nearby. He takes prode in the changes in the village but is saddened by the amalgamation of farms so losing one family perhaps. He hopes the traditions of country life will be carried on as he loves the village, its folk and the active life he leads.
